title: WebDAV attempts HTTPS on HTTP-only Configuration
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

**rclone** attempts to connect via HTTPS on port 443 even when configured as HTTP.  This fails with a connection refused error, since this local SharePoint server is HTTP on port 80 only.  My ultimate goal is to bulk upload everything from this legacy on-premise SharePoint server to a secure cloud instance.  (**rclone** is working well for the cloud end, just not this local local end.)  I looked at the various available SSL related switches, none seemed appropriate.  Did I miss something important in the config?  Please advise, thank you.

```
$ cat /home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf

[localsharepoint]
type = webdav
url = http://sharepoint.example.org/
vendor = sharepoint
user = user@example.org
pass = xxxxxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
```

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.48.0
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.11.10
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

```
Linux unit.example.org 5.3.11-100.fc29.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Nov 12 20:41:25 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

SharePoint via WebDAV 

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`$ rclone --vfs-cache-mode writes mount localsharepoint: /home/user/localsharepoint`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2020/07/07 16:48:38 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.48.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "--vfs-cache-mode" "writes" "mount" "localsharepoint:" "/home/user/localsharepoint"]
2020/07/07 16:48:38 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2020/07/07 16:48:39 Failed to create file system for "localsharepoint:": Error while grabbing cookies from endpoint: %v: Post https://sharepoint.example.org/_forms/default.aspx?wa=wsignin1.0: dial tcp 172.16.11.22:443: connect: connection refused
```
A newer version of rclone (v1.51.0) gives a different error…
```
2020/07/07 17:32:43 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.51.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "--vfs-cache-mode" "writes" "mount" "localsharepoint:" "/home/user/localsharepoint"]
2020/07/07 17:32:43 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2020/07/07 17:32:43 Failed to create file system for "localsharepoint:": :  ()
```

The site itself works fine from this workstation via HTTP directly, for example, here's the **curl** server info response…

```
$ curl  --ntlm -u example.org/user -I http://sharepoint.example.org/SitePages/Home.aspx
Enter host password for user 'example.org/user':

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Cache-Control: private, max-age=0
Content-Length: 98859
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Expires: Tue, 23 Jun 2020 00:18:05 GMT
Last-Modified: Wed, 08 Jul 2020 00:18:05 GMT
Server: Microsoft-IIS/10.0
X-SharePointHealthScore: 1
X-AspNet-Version: 4.0.30319
SPRequestGuid: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
request-id: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
X-FRAME-OPTIONS: SAMEORIGIN
SPRequestDuration: 114
SPIisLatency: 0
Set-Cookie: http%3A%2F%2Fsharepoint%2Eexample%2Eorg%2FDiscovery=WorkspaceSiteName=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx&WorkspaceSiteUrl=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx==&WorkspaceSiteTime=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx==; expires=Fri, 07-Aug-2020 00:18:06 GMT; path=/_vti_bin/Discovery.asmx
Persistent-Auth: true
X-Powered-By: ASP.NET
MicrosoftSharePointTeamServices: 16.0.0.4807
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-MS-InvokeApp: 1; RequireReadOnly
Date: Wed, 08 Jul 2020 00:18:05 GMT
```
